data.question: What are the names of the two novel metal-organic frameworks discussed?
What is the purpose of functionalising the MOFs with pentamethylcyclopentadienyl iridium(III) chloride?
data.answer: For catalytic conversion of carbon dioxide to formate

data.question: True or False: The synthesis of JMS-6 and JMS-7 involves the use of 2,2'-bipyridyl-4,4'-dicarboxylic acid.
What is the highest turnover number (TON) achieved by Ir(III)@JMS-6a and Ir(III)@JMS-7a?
What method was used to confirm the successful grafting of the complex to the MOF?
data.answer: XPS of the functionalised MOFs showing downfield shifts in the N 1s binding energy

data.question: True or False: The functionalised MOFs were tested for their ability to convert CO2 to formate in the absence of an organic base.
What was the role of triethylamine in the synthesis of JMS-6?
data.answer: It was mixed with 2,2'-bipyridyl-4,4'-dicarboxylic acid and DMF before adding Nd(NO3)3·6H2O

data.question: True or False: The structures of JMS-6 and JMS-7 were solved by direct methods and refined anisotropically on least-squares with SHELXL.
What was the effect of soaking the activated MOFs in water and methanol for 24 hours?
data.answer: The lower peak which disappeared upon guest removal in both JMS-6 and JMS-7 is retained, indicating water and methanol can occupy the coordinated sites left by the DMF and water molecules.

data.question: True or False: The catalytic performance of Ir(III)@JMS-6a and Ir(III)@JMS-7a is higher than all the Ir(III) catalysts reported in the literature.
What was the optimum temperature found for the hydrogenation of CO2 to formate using Ir(III)@JMS-7a?
True or False: The functionalised MOFs could be recycled up to three times with Ir(III)@JMS-7a maintaining an activity of 90%.
What was the role of Et3N in the hydrogenation experiments?
data.answer: It was used as a base and showed the highest TON of 578 when used with Ir(III)@JMS-7a.

data.question: True or False: The PXRD patterns of the functionalised MOFs matched well with the activated phase, ruling out the possibility of structural transformation induced by guest removal.
What was the effect of increasing the pressure of H2 in the hydrogenation reaction?
data.answer: An increase in H2 partial pressure facilitated the formation of more Ir–H species, which is a key intermediate in formate production, yielding more formate.

data.question: True or False: The SEM images showed evidence of nanoparticles after catalysis, indicating that catalysis was due to Ir(0) centres.
What was the calculated and experimental diffraction peaks agreement indicative of?
data.answer: The phase purity of the synthesised MOFs JMS-6 and JMS-7.

data.question: True or False: The total weight loss during thermal analysis of JMS-6 and JMS-7 is the same.
What was the significance of the BET studies on JMS-6 and Ir(III)@JMS-6?
data.answer: To determine the amount of N2 uptake, pore volume, and pore diameter, which decreased after functionalization, indicating the Ir(III) complex occupied some pore spaces in JMS-6a.

data.question: True or False: The functionalised MOFs exhibited a TON higher than the homogeneous Ir(III) complex used for functionalisation.
